column4: When you setup VNC through Gnome in Ubuntu jaunty which server does it use by default?
its using its own gnome version. I think its called 'vino' Unless ive miss read what ive read about it..
I have installed tightvnc, and I think I can connect, but my password never works.  How do you tell if tight vnc is running through command line?

you Have to run tightvncserver (via 'vncserver' command and set up a vncpassword to use it.. Teres 2 ways vnc can work. Share the CURRENT desktop.. or create a 'hidden' desktop TightVnc creates a sweperate hidden desktoop. It does NOT share the current desktop
